title: Sergey Lebedev (footballer)
text:
Sergey Elefertovich Lebedev () (born 31 January 1969 in the <a href="Uzbek%20Soviet%20Socialist%20Republic">Uzbek SSR</a>, <a href="Soviet%20Union">Soviet Union</a>) is a retired <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> midfielder. Lebedev is a former <a href="Uzbekistan%20national%20football%20team">Uzbekistani international</a>, who obtained a total number of 33 caps during his career, scoring ten goals. He later became a football coach.
Playing career.
Lebedev started playing professionally in "Turbina Naberezhnye Chelny" in 1985. He completed 3 seasons for "Turbina" and wento to <a href="FC%20Dynamo%20Kirov">FC Dynamo Kirov</a> in 1988. In 1989–91 he played for <a href="Neftyanik%20Fergana">Neftyanik Fergana</a> and 1990 he won <a href="Soviet%20Second%20League">Soviet Second League</a> with club and promoted to <a href="Soviet%20First%20League">Soviet First League</a>.
In 1992–1999 he played for <a href="Neftchi%20Farg%27ona">Neftchi Farg'ona</a> and won 4 times Uzbekistani championship and two <a href="Uzbek%20Cup">Uzbek Cup</a>s. He became Neftchi's "best League goalscorer" in 1996 and 1998 seasons. His last club played was also "Neftchi Farg'ona". He joined club in 2006 after playing for <a href="Metallurg%20Bekabad">Metallurg Bekabad</a> in 2005.
International.
Lebedev capped 33 matches, scoring 10 goals for national team. He was one of the player of Uzbekistan who won Asian Games in 1994. He scored two goals in Asian Games 1994. Lebedev scored his second goal in <a href="Football%20at%20the%201994%20Asian%20Games%23Knockout%20round">Final match</a> against China on 8-minute as Uzbekistan after that began leading 2:0. He also participated in 2 <a href="AFC%20Asian%20Cup">AFC Asian Cup</a>s: 1996 AFC Asian Cup and 2000 AFC Asian Cup.
Managing career.
After getting retired in 2006, he started his managing career at club level. He started to work as assistant coach to <a href="Yuriy%20Sarkisyan">Yuriy Sarkisyan</a> in "Neftchi Farg'ona". He remained in club coaching stuff when Yuriy Sarkisyan was sacked in May 2013.
